channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Yen surges after Shigeru Ishiba, supporter of higher interest rates, wins vote to become Japan prime minister
item.description: Ishiba supports the Bank of Japan's exit from its unorthodox ultra-loose policies,

item.title: Gen Alpha is stealing zippers from Nike backpacks to resell them to victims at hiked-up prices
item.description: The iPad kid generation has targeted Nike Elite as its latest brand obsession.

item.title: Shigeru Ishiba to Be Next Prime Minister of Japan
item.description: Shigeru Ishiba, a former defense minister known for his plainspoken opinions, will replace Fumio Kishida next week.

item.title: In Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley, Days of Destruction After Months of Calm
item.description: The Bekaa Valley, a Hezbollah bastion in eastern Lebanon, had mostly been spared over 11 months of war. But The New York Times saw widespread devastat...

item.description: The gathering in New York is part of a nearly weeklong U.S. visit by the Ukrainian president in which he has made appeals to both Democrats and Republ...

item.title: Pope Francis, Visiting Belgium, Is Met With Anger Over Clerical Sexual Abuse
item.description: During a trip to Luxembourg and Belgium, Francis will spend an hour meeting with 15 people who were abused by Roman Catholic clergy. Survivors say it ...

item.title: Titan hearing paints image of sub company that ignored warnings, put profits over people—and had an explorer’s spirit
item.description: Testimony painted contrasting images of greed and hubris as OceanGate sought out well-heeled clients for its submersible made from carbon fiber.

item.title: British semiconductor giant Arm reportedly tried to buy a chunk of struggling Intel, but was turned away
item.description: Arm reportedly approached Arm about buying up Intel's product division, but was quickly rebuffed by the crisis-strewn chipmaker.

item.title: Live Updates: Netanyahu to Address U.N. Amid Doubts Over Cease-Fire Push

item.title: Helene Roars on After Lashing Florida, and the Charges Facing Eric Adams
item.description: Plus, Batman joins the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

item.title: How Trump’s 60% tariffs on China imports and up to 20% on everything else would work—and what they would do
item.description: “Tariffs are the greatest thing ever invented,’’ Trump said this month in Flint, Mich.
